summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeThe Original Lanostick by Lanolips is a fast working balm, in an even faster tube. Your 100% natural, 100% perfect day-balm-to-go.
details: DetailsBenefitsFrom the makers of the "World's Best Lip Balm" comes the 90's inspired wind-up LanostickThe perfect day-balm for pockets, bags and on-the-goA rich layer glides on like a hug of hydration - deeply and properly conditioningThe natural waxes seal the moisture in for hoursFormulated with lanolin + natural waxes and butters and vitamin EFeaturesFemale-Owned Beauty BrandTSA-Approved, travel friendly beauty productCruelty-FreeCertified by Leaping BunnyVegetarian100% NaturalFormulated WithoutArtificial ColorsFragrancesParabensPthalatesPetrolatumPEGsMineral OilItem 2549012How To UseApply to lips as needed throughout the day.Precautions: For external use only.IngredientsLanolin*, Ricinus Communis (Castor) Seed Oil*, Capryloyl Glycerin/Sebacic Acid Copolymer*, Cera Alba (Beeswax)*, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride*, Persea Gratissima (Avocado) Oil*, Jojoba Esters (Simmondsia Chinensis)*, Aroma (Nat Flavour)*, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter*, Euphorbia Cerifera (Candelilla) Cera*, Magnifera Indica (Mango) Seed Butter*, Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil*, Copernicia Cerifera (Carnauba) Cera*, Tocopherol (Vit E)*. *100% Natural
how_to_use: Apply to lips as needed throughout the day.Precautions: For external use only.

reviews.headline: Beautiful formula, need more product for price
reviews.comments: This is such a nourishing, non-sticky, cushiony lip balm, and I'm happy I picked it up while it was 50% off. My only issue with it is something another reviewer also shared, which is that there isn't a whole lot of product in the tube, so with regular daily use, you'll go through this in 3 or 4 weeks. I've had mine for a week and a half, and I'm already one third of the way done with it.

reviews.headline: GENUINELY THE BEST CHAPSTICK EVER
reviews.comments: i literally bought this today bc it was on sale and let me tell you - I HAVE NEVER TRIED A MORE MOISTURIZING CHAPSTICK. i am very prone to bitting and licking my chapped lips and this is a lifesaver i can already tell. the lemon smell doesn't bother me, its very light and not potent especially if you layer with other lippies. but like when i tell you this is better than burts bees, aquaphor, chapstick, I MEAN IT. 100% worth it

reviews.headline: Forever a favorite
reviews.comments: My lips love this, it's so smooth!

reviews.headline: I would buy this again and again
reviews.comments: Love this product because it has minimal ingredients that are all natural. A little pricey but I love it!

reviews.headline: The Packaging leaves much to be desired
reviews.comments: I think the formulation is fine. It's thick and definitely obvious when applied to the lips. It's not particularly moisturizing for my lips but I do like it's instant smoothness. The lemon balm like scent is pretty good to me also. My only complaint is that the stick packaging leaves so much product unused in my opinion. Once you've used the product the barrel, there's still at least a gram of product left to be used. I don't want to apply it by hand or by brush, it's just inconvenient and/or unsanitary to me depending on the circumstance. If I was someone that was big into depotting my products, it probably would be fine but I'm not.

reviews.headline: Saved my chapped lips
reviews.comments: I had permanently chapped lips that were painful.  This balm took care of them in no time.

reviews.headline: It's ok
reviews.comments: I was hoping to love this but it's not the same as the 101 balm. Not as think and doesn't last nearly as long through the day Still a good chapstick, just if your looking for a thicker lip ointment stick with the 101

reviews.headline: Nightly lip treatment
reviews.comments:
I use it as a nightly lip treatment, and I love that I wake up and can still smoosh it around and feel it on my lips. 

I know lanolin is a common allergin so be aware it could make dermatitis worse.

reviews.headline: My Go To
reviews.comments: I love all Lanolips products, but this one is my favorite. I always buy them two at a time, so I never run out! It is sooo nice! It makes ny lips so soft and smooth, even during the cold, winter months! I love how easy and mess-free it is! I wish they made them in different scents, because I woul own them all!

reviews.headline: probably the best balm stick
reviews.comments: this is by far the best lip balm that comes in a stick applicator. you only need a swipe or two for great coverage. makes my lips feel amazing. however, i only use this in the winter. it's so cold where I live,  its difficult to use the tubes because the products harden. using this stick is so much easier. I agree with the other reviews that say it's very easy to use the product quickly, I wish there was a way for there to be more product in the tube, because its pricey for the size. but the convenience and quality is worth it to me. at least in winter time

reviews.headline: Does the job!
reviews.comments:
I have wanted a non-petrolatum unscented/unflavored and non-tinted lip balm for quite a while. I watched many youtube video reviews of a variety of lip balms and found this which has relatively cleaner ingredients. 

I'm mostly satisfied with it - I have been using it almost daily around twice a day, and it keeps my lips moisturized without feeling like they're weighed down by it. As the description says, it's unscented, unflavored and non-tinted. I do think it's a tad expensive, but I like it so far.

reviews.headline: Peeling lips
reviews.comments: I have used nothing but aquaphor for a few years and had no problems but i've heard great things about this product so I decided to try it. My throat felt itchy when i wore it and my lips started peeling within 2 days. It was so bad, to the point they bled. I dont recommend this.

reviews.headline: Pleasantly surprised
reviews.comments: Hi.  First time user of Lanolips.  I chose the stick because I prefer that application.  A lot of reviewers were turned off by the lemon smell but I enjoyed it, plus it made my lips feels good, and it stayed on longer than expected.  Plus it's on sale right now under $12 buck!  A great stocking stuffer for sure.

reviews.headline: Favorite Lip Balm
reviews.comments: I love this lip balm. Moisturizes and has natural ingredients. I do wish they gave a bit more product in the packaging, but it's fine because a little goes a long way. You don't need to super coat your lips, a good swipe or two works great, just rub your lips together after application.

reviews.headline: Worked great!
reviews.comments: Was fast working and really healed my severely chapped lips nicely!
Best balm on the market. The quality is worth the price.

reviews.headline: dupe for "FRESH SUGAR original formula"
reviews.comments: for over 10 years, I was a faithful user of "fresh sugar original formula". fast forward to last year (I think it was last year), where they changed their formula. I hated the new one and kept looking for something similar. FINALLY, I found this product. it's is AMAZING! I bought a keychain container so I can carry it everywhere with me. it is moisturizing, thick (in a pleasant way), and long lasting. I cannot go a day without using this beauty.

reviews.headline: Fine Balm but the Amount in Tube is Absurd
reviews.comments: I bought this to keep at my desk at work so I wouldn't have to use my fingers to reapply. The product is fine, I dont think it's better than other cheaper products. But the amount of product in the tube really bothers me. How is it practically empty after less than a month of just using it a couple of times a day at work?

reviews.headline: $$$$ Miracle Product
reviews.comments: I started acccut.ane last month and my already-dry lips literally cracked and bled. Lanolips absolutely saved my lips, but the tube lasted LESS THAN 3 DAYS! I'll have to splurge while I'm on this med, but won't spend $200+/ month for continued use.

reviews.headline: New staple
reviews.comments: Ive always been a fan of aquaphor now this has hands down replaced it. My new staple no doubt

faceoff_positive.comments: This is by far, the best lip balm I've ever tried. I love the lemon smell, it glides on so smoothly, the subtle sheen is so adorable. It's so moisturizing, I use the 101 ointment as well, but I like how this one doesn't leave a white cast if I want to lather one more often. The only thing that grinds my gears is that it dwindles very fast. It's very emulsifying so it's easy to get carried away cause it melts like butter. If you are going to use this everyday, this will last 2-3 weeks tops because it's not a long tube of product to begin with, makes me sad because this isn't cheap! However, I can't go back.
faceoff_positive.headline: I begrudgingly buy this.

faceoff_negative.comments: I have been searching for a replacement balm ever since my holy grail lip balm was absolutely ruined by reformulation. I was hoping the lanolin and beeswax combination in this would work. Unfortunately, I am still looking after trying this product. I was immediately turned off by the smell when I opened the tube, so much so that I almost didn't even put it on. It is a little bit less offensive when it's actually on my lips, but I still catch the odd whiff of lemon, and it just makes me want to scrub this off. It adds more shine to my lips as well, and makes them more slippery than I like, more so than the Lanolips ointment, probably because this has added oils. Seems to work slightly better than your average lip balm, though still not nearly as well as my former fave. The stick formulation is a plus, especially these days, when even touching clean fingers to my lips makes me twitchy. But even a good product isn't going to work if I hate to use it. I'll keep this for emergencies, if only because it's too much hassle to return it. If you love lemon scented things, this would still be worth a try for you, but I won't be purchasing this again.
faceoff_negative.headline: Unpleasant to use, smells like Pledge
